intro: Otherodendron japonicum, commonly known as Japanese tree peony, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan and parts of China. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink and red. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces fruit that splits open to release seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. The botanical features of Otherodendron japonicum make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and horticultural collections.
